verses.roman:
nava-ghana-snigdha-varṇa, dalitāñjana-cikkaṇa,
indīvara-nindi sukomala
jini' upamāna-gaṇa, hare sabāra netra-mana,
kṛṣṇa-kānti parama prabala

synonyms: nava-ghana—a newly formed cloud; snigdha—attractive; varṇa—bodily complexion; dalita—powdered; añjana—ointment; cikkaṇa—polished; indīvara—a blue lotus flower; nindi—defeating; su-komala—soft; jini—surpassing; upamāna-gaṇa—all comparison; hare—attracts; sabāra—of all; netra-mana—the eyes and mind; kṛṣṇa-kānti—the complexion of Kṛṣṇa; parama prabala—supremely powerful.
translation: Caitanya Mahāprabhu continued: "Śrī Kṛṣṇa's complexion is as polished as powdered eye ointment. It surpasses the beauty of a newly formed cloud and is softer than a blue lotus flower. Indeed, His complexion is so pleasing that it attracts the eyes and mind of everyone, and it is so powerful that it defies all comparison.
